CatDescriptText: Kay Palmer, of 7291 Lemington Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, p. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "That presents a problem. I know some who have done so and are content.  Others, if they are working, show no desire to be married.  While they are receiving a salary, they don't want to bother.  I know a woman, in her 50s who was married to a man who was a widower, and they are living together very contentedly.  However, that's one in a million."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Kay Palmer wearing eyeglasses, patterned scarf around neck, and dark overcoat, standing in front of Palmer Restaurant sign, Downtown
